Jim Ancona wrote:
> Not to beat a dead horse, but clients may build URIs based on 
> hypertext instructions from the server. That's why HTML FORMs 
> are restful. FWIW, there's a proposal for HTML5 FORMs to use 
> URI templates, see 
> http://www.mail-archive.com/whatwg@.../msg08626.html.

Glad to see someone else is *finally* proposing it, and not even a year
later!   ;-)

http://blog.welldesignedurls.org/2007/01/11/proposing-uri-templates-for-webf
orms-2/

-- 
-Mike Schinkel
